fundamentalRights.title: 1.Right to Equality
fundamentalRights.description: Ensures equality before the law and prohibits discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

fundamentalRights.title: 2.Right to Freedom
fundamentalRights.description: Provides citizens with freedom of speech and expression, assembly, association, movement, residence, and the right to practice any profession or occupation.

fundamentalRights.title: 3.Right against Exploitation
fundamentalRights.description: Prohibits all forms of forced labor, child labor, and human trafficking.

fundamentalRights.title: 4.Right to Freedom of Religion
fundamentalRights.description: Allows all citizens the freedom to profess, practice, and propagate any religion.

fundamentalRights.title: 5.Cultural and Educational Rights
fundamentalRights.description: Protects the rights of cultural, religious, and linguistic minorities by enabling them to conserve their heritage.

fundamentalRights.title: 6.Right to Constitutional Remedies
fundamentalRights.description: Allows individuals to seek enforcement of their fundamental rights against entities infringing upon them.
